labels.analysis: The MCP Server focuses on integrating with Clockify to automate time-tracking workflows, allowing users to list projects, track time entries, and generate detailed reports. It provides tools for querying data, adding time entries, and retrieving summaries, which helps streamline time management and productivity tasks. The server's core functionality revolves around managing and analyzing time-tracking data, making it particularly useful for teams and individuals who need structured time reporting.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Daily Productivity" is chosen because the server directly enhances time management and workflow efficiency, which are key aspects of personal and professional productivity. The secondary label "Time & Calendar" is included to emphasize the server's time-tracking and reporting capabilities. No custom label is needed as the predefined labels adequately cover the server's functionality.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: Clockify Time Tracking Integration
server_info_crawled.author: @inakianduaga/clockify-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Enable advanced automation and reporting for your Clockify workspace by integrating with this server. List projects, users, and time entries, add new time entries, and generate detailed summary reports by user and project. Streamline your time-tracking workflows and gain insights through LLM-powered interactions.

tools.name: listProjects
tools.description: Deploy Server Clockify Time Tracking Integration Claim Server @inakianduaga/clockify-mcp Try in Playground listProjects

tools.name: getTimeEntries
tools.description: List time entries for the authenticated user. Optional: start, end (ISO8601).

tools.name: addTimeEntry
tools.description: Add a time entry to a project.

tools.name: listUsers
tools.description: List all users in the workspace.

tools.name: getUserTimeEntries
tools.description: List time entries for a specified user. Optional: start, end (ISO8601).

tools.name: getSummaryReport
tools.description: Get a summary report of hours by user/project for a date range. Optional: userIds, projectIds.

tools.name: getUserTimeEntriesByName
tools.description: List time entries for a user by name (case-insensitive, partial match allowed). Optional: start, end (ISO8601).

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@inakianduaga/clockify-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
